sfField.summary: Not Applicable
This is an internal system field defined by the formula_extid field. Neither the formula_extid, nor the externalid field itself, is currently displayed on any Rootstock User pages.
Identifies the Company that this Division is associated with.

Designates whether the company will have a centralized "repository" (Division) for maintaining Engineering Item Masters, BOMs, Revisions and ECOs. When checked, the Centralized Eng Divison needs to be identified on the Company record.
This is an internal system field used to define the external ID of a record, which is also an internal system field. Neither is currently displayed on any Rootstock User pages.
Internal formula for constructing the associated field.
Internal formula for constructing the associated name field.
Engineer responsible for defining and controlling changes to this part.
This is an internal system field used to define the searchindex of a record, which is also an internal system field. Neither is currently displayed on any Rootstock User pages.
Internal Index
Not Applicable
The date when the status is changed to ACTIVE (or date Item created, if initial status is ACTIVE).
User defined description. This description is displayed throughout the Rootstock product in combination with the associated Item Number.
When checked, this indicates this item is a disassembly item, an item harvested for components
This is the core organizational unit. This is typically the plant where the manufacturing is performed, as well as the receipt of purchased material, and fulfillment of sales orders.

This is the Engineering Unit of Measure. There can be different Units of Measure for Purchasing, Inventory, and Sales Orders, with appropriate conversion factors maintained in the Rootstock software to process.
When checked, this indicates that costing for this item will be done on a first-in-first-out (FIFO) basis. This is only applicable under Moving Average Cost method.
TBD - H

This is the Commodity Code associated with this Item. When adding a new item, the C.C. is used to default Inv Source, Lot & Serial Tracking, Eng UOM & Resp Engineer, along with values needed to add the Inv Item Master & Purchase Item Master (if applicable).
If checked, the item is inactive and can not be on an active bom.
Division is the core organizational unit. The Inventory Division is typically where the manufacturing is performed, as well as the receipt of purchased material, and fulfillment of sales orders.
Lookup to the associated Engineering Revision for the Inventory Revision Master Item.
The Engineering Revision (against the Inventory Revision Master Item) that spawned the creation of this Item.
When checked, indicates that this item was created from an Inventory Revision Master Item.

When checked, denotes that this item is an Inventory Revision Master. As such, it will spawn another Item Master that will be used on BOMs, used in Inventory, etc. The "master" item is the vehicle for revisions that will spawn new items for each revision.
A unique alpha-numeric identifier of this record. Up to 50 characters.

Used to differentiate labor only items from direct material. Blank is OK and treated as Direct Material. Note that once the given item is in use, this value cannot be changed. Valid values are

Direct Material
Labor Only
TBD - H
TBD - H
Engineer responsible for defining and controlling changes to this part.
TBD - H

Source codes are: PURCHASED - Items purchased for Inventory via a Purchase Order. MANUFACTURED - Items assembled in house for Inventory via a Work Order. SUBCONTRACT - Items assembled by a Vendor from components supplied to the Vendor.
TBD - H

Status values are ACTIVE (default) or PENDING. When a new Engineering item is created with ACTIVE status, the Inventory Item record is automatically created.. When it is created with PENDING status, only the Engineering Item record is created.
TBD - H
TBD - H
When Checked, units are tracked.

Determines if this item is controlled by lot number. Valid values are 'Yes', it IS controlled by lot, or 'No', it is not. Items may be both lot and serial controlled, either lot or serial controlled, or neither.
TBD - H
'Y' indicates that this item is tracked by serial number. Valid values are 'Y' or 'N'. Items may be both lot and serial tracked, either lot OR serial tracked, or not tracked by either option.
Valid Engineering Types are: Standard, Phantom, or Reference.
This is an internal system field not currently displayed on any Rootstock User pages
This is an internal system field which is not currently displayed on any Rootstock User pages.
